children.value: Most times in the PagerDuty web UI are rendered in the desired time zone of the user currently logged in. There are some exceptions to this on the User, Team, and System reports in
. When users are added, their personal time zones will match the
by default, and they can change their

if necessary. It’s important to note that a user profile can have a different default time zone than the account level time zone, and that all on-call schedules will be viewed in your selected time zone.
Only the Account Owner can change the account-level time zone.
Log in to PagerDuty as the Account Owner.
In the upper right of the page navigate to the
Under Account Details, select the Default Time Zone from the drop-down menu.
in the top right corner of any page.
next to the time zone under your contact information.
Select the desired time zone from the drop-down list.
When you create a new schedule, it will be set to the

by default. You may, however, choose to edit the schedule to be in a different time zone than the account's. If you are changing your schedule's time zone and it has users from varying time zones, please read the following section on how
To change a schedule's time zone:
Under the schedule's Name and Description fields, you will see a
dropdown. Select your preferred time zone.
If your account has users in different time zones, there are a few things to keep in mind with respect to how
The default time zone setting of a schedule will match the
if you do not wish for it to match the account’s time zone.
Users who are not in the same time zone as the schedule will still
the times on that schedule as being in their time zone. For example, if an account is set to USA EST and it is 9:00, but user Marge has set her account to USA PST, she will
In the case of DST discrepancies between users and schedules, the above details still apply. These users should take note of the following and the potential impact to their schedules:
: If a schedule is set to USA EST (observing DST) at 2:00, but user Jon has his account set to
(not observing DST) at 7:00, when DST begins in the schedule's time zone, his view of his schedule will advance to 8:00, but his clock will remain at 7:00.

: If a schedule is set to UTC (not observing DST) at 7:00 and user Emily’s account is set to US EST at 2:00, when DST begins in Emily’s time zone, her clock will advance to 3:00, but her view of her schedule will remain at 2:00.
